node.title: Instagram CEO says it's "critical" to have multi-platform youth safety rules
node.description: Instagram CEO Adam Mosseri told a Senate subcommittee investigating the harmful effects of the photo sharing app on teenagers that "keeping young people safe online is not just about one company."

node.title: I’m Furious at the Unvaccinated
node.description: They don’t only leave themselves vulnerable to the virus, they make everyone more vulnerable.

node.title: Woman Stole Daughter’s Identity to Get Loans and Attend College, U.S. Says
node.description: Laura Oglesby, 48, of Missouri, who pleaded guilty to intentionally providing false information to the Social Security Administration, lived as someone nearly half her age, the authorities said.

node.title: Michigan County Has Charged 18 Youths Ages 12 to 17 for Making Threats Against Schools
node.description: Wayne County Prosecutor Kym Worthy said 18 students have been charged with making threats in the week since a school shooting that killed 4 in the state.

node.title: 7 Members of Suspended Fraternity Arrested for Cyberstalking Student Who Reported Hazing
node.description: According to Lafayette County Justice Court records, they were arrested Friday after turning themselves in. They were released on a bond of $5,000 each.

node.title: International trade shows strong growth after setback last year
node.description: International trade has bounced back from the pandemic, with strong growth over the past year.

node.title: Consumer NZ to test products for sustainability and repairability
node.description: Consumer New Zealand says it's making the biggest change to its product testing process in more than 50 years of existence - by only recommending appliances that last. Audio

node.title: Intensifying strategic competition leading to risk of conflict in Indo-Pacific - report
node.description: A new defence report identifies 'China's rise' and its power struggle with the United States as one of the pre-eminent security risks in the Indo-Pacific. Audio

node.title: Watch: Christopher Luxon speaks to media in Christchurch
node.description: National Party leader Christopher Luxon has spoken to media after visiting Christchurch Boys' High School.

node.title: Man jailed for shooting and injuring police officer
node.description: A man who shot and injured a police officer at a routine traffic stop in Hamilton in July has been jailed for seven years and eight months.

node.title: Otago council ramps up campaign against rabbits
node.description: Lax Otago landowners will soon have to foot the bill if the regional council has to step in and deal with their rabbit problems.

node.title: Some in California have to limit their daily water usage. Here's what that means
node.description: A 10-minute shower uses about 25 gallons of water. One load of laundry uses 40 gallons.

node.title: Police in one Wisconsin city want to reduce crime by becoming a neighbor
node.description: Six houses in Racine, Wisconsin, are staffed by police, whose job it is to get to know the communities they serve.

node.title: He Was a Black Star 60 Years Before Jackie. Now He’s a Hall of Famer.
node.description: Elected by the Hall’s Early Days committee, Bud Fowler was a pioneer who played organized professional baseball against white players as early as 1878.

node.title: More Evidence Muddles Durham’s Case on Lawyer’s Meeting With F.B.I.
node.description: One disclosure dovetails with the special counsel John Durham’s indictment against Michael Sussmann, while several others clash with it.

node.title: Father and Son Arrested on Suspicion of Starting the Caldor Fire
node.description: The men have not been charged but were arrested in connection with the 15th-largest blaze in California’s recorded history. It burned more than 200,000 acres near Lake Tahoe.

node.title: Senate Votes to Scrap Biden Vaccine Mandate as Republicans Eye 2022
node.description: The action was largely symbolic, but it allowed Republicans to press an attack on Democrats that is likely to be central to their midterm election campaigns.

node.title: Bulletproof Vests For School Kids? Arizona Fire Captain Says They're Now a Necessity
node.description: "I just wanted to give people something that could actually make a difference," the fire captain said.

node.title: 5 Takeaways From Wednesday's Senate Hearing With Instagram CEO Adam Mosseri
node.description: Instagram's Mosseri proposed creating an "industry body" to help oversee social media companies moving forward.

node.title: Car Yanked From Alabama Creek May Have Remains of Kyle Wade Clinkscales, Who Vanished in '76
node.description: On Jan. 12, 1976, Clinkscales, who was 22 years old when he disappeared, left LaGrange, Georgia, to drive 45 miles back to Auburn, but never arrived.

node.title: Kim Potter Trial Begins With Defense Saying All Daunte Wright Had to Do Was Surrender
node.description: Potter's trial began Wednesday, with prosecutors saying she betrayed her badge and training when she shot Wright, and the defense saying it was an accident.

node.title: Cause of Training Fall That Killed SEAL Commander Brian Bourgeois Under Investigation
node.description: On Saturday, Bourgeois, 43, was injured when he was fast-roping down from a helicopter, Naval Special Warfare Command said Wednesday. He died Monday.

node.title: At Least 85 Criminal Cases Dismissed After Dozens of Cops Swapped Homophobic, Racist Texts
node.description: Hundreds of criminal cases could be in jeopardy after a Los Angeles Times investigation revealed offensive texts sent by several Torrance police officers.

node.title: Man and Children, Ages 9 and 6, Killed in Car During 'Targeted Assassination,' Cops Say
node.description: Two armed suspects approached the vehicle the three victims were in and fired into the car "without any apparent warning or provocation," said police.

node.title: Donald Trump Says If He Doesn't Run in 2024, His 'Base Is Going to Be Very Angry'
node.description: Previously, Trump told Fox News host Sean Hannity that he had made up his mind about whether he will run for president again in 2024.

node.title: More advice needed before accelerating vaccine booster rollout - Hipkins

node.title: Tensions Rise at Columbia as Strikers Fear Retaliation From University
node.description: After administrators sent an email saying that students who remained on strike after Friday were not guaranteed jobs next term, union members turned up the heat.

node.title: Judge Appoints Special Master to Review Material Seized From Project Veritas
